main.name: Runlai Yang
main.description: Actively looking for a full-time SDE position. M.S in Computer Science at GWU
main.bio: My name is Runlai Yang and I’m a recent graduate master (May 2020) in computer science from The George Washington University (GWU). I love coding. It is fascinating that software can be used to solve real-life problems in so many areas. I believe the power of programming to help people and improve the quality of life for people from all over the world.
main.contactmessage: Get in touch with me to receive further details.

education.description: Selected Courses: Design & Analysis of Algorithms, Advanced Software Paradigms, Computer System Architecture, Object-Oriented, Design, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning
Selected Courses: C/C++/JAVA, Mobile Application Development, Data Structure and Algorithms, Principle of Operating System, Computer Network and Communication, Database Principle and Design, etc.

work.title: Software Developer
work.description:
● Created back-end applications and RESTful APIs using Java 8/J2EE,Spring Boot.
● Designed and implemented the project by using MVC software design pattern.
● Configured Swagger for API documentation.
● Used Hibernate as an ORM framework to map Java classes to database tables.
● Used Spring Data MongoDB to implement mapping between documents and POJOs and repository style data access layer.
● Deployed and used database server on docker container and managed database with PostgreSQL and MongoDB at local.
● Integrated third-party application AWS S3,SQS with SpringBoot.
● Increased the web security both in authentication side and authorization side by JSON web token (JWT) method.
● Test-driven development using Junit and Mockito.
● Managed project dependencies and automated building process by Maven.
● Used Maven Flyway to migrate the database schema.
● Configured and deployed the application on Tomcat server.
● Used Git for source code version control.
● Collaborated closely with DevOps in CI/CD pipeline.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.
